cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Vault Sealed Incident
The Vault Sealed incident type occurs when an instance of the Vault has been sealed due to an error or issue. This can cause disruption to the system and requires immediate attention to resolve the issue and unseal the Vault instance. It is important to identify the root cause of the issue in order to prevent it from happening again in the future.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## List all pods in the namespace

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl get pods -n ${NAMESPACE}`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check if the pod is running

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl describe pod ${POD_NAME} -n ${NAMESPACE}`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the logs of the pod

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl logs ${POD_NAME} -n ${NAMESPACE}`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the status of the Vault server

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE | `vault status`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check if the Vault server is sealed

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE | `vault status | grep Sealed`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the Vault server logs

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl logs ${VAULT_POD_NAME} -n ${NAMESPACE}`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Check the Vault server configuration

cells.name: cell_15
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE | `vault operator init -status`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Check the Vault server health

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE | `vault operator check`

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## Check if the Vault server has sufficient resources

cells.name: cell_19
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | limit=1 | random=1 | `kubectl describe pod ${VAULT_POD_NAME} -n ${NAMESPACE} | grep -E "Limits|Requests"`

cells.name: cell_20
cells.content: ## Check the Vault server's storage

cells.name: cell_21
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE | `vault storage check`

cells.name: cell_22
cells.content: ## Check the Vault server's audit logs

cells.name: cell_23
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE | `vault audit list`

cells.name: cell_24
cells.content: ## Issues with the Vault service configuration leading to a failure in the Vault instance.

cells.name: cell_25
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | random=1 | limit=1 | invoke_vault_status_check($VAULT_POD_NAME, $VAULT_CONTAINER_NAME, $NAMESPACE)

cells.name: cell_26
cells.content: ## unseal the vault

cells.name: cell_27
cells.content: pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | app='shoreline' | random=1 | limit=1 | invoke_vault_unseal($POD_NAME, $VAULT_NAME, $NAMESPACE)
